intro: Ctenopsis garcinii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of small, brightly colored blooms. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Ctenopsis garcinii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
